author: George Orwell
annotation: A dark dystopian story about a society under absolute surveillance. Winston Smith struggles to preserve independent thought and dignity while living under the oppressive rule of Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
annotation: A witty romantic novel about family, social expectations, and personal growth. Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy must overcome pride and misconceptions to discover true love.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
annotation: A moving coming-of-age story set in the racially divided American South. Young Scout Finch witnesses injustice while her father Atticus fights to uphold morality and fairness.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
annotation: A portrait of love, wealth, and illusion during the Jazz Age. Mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby seeks to recreate a vanished past, chasing a dream destined to collapse.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
annotation: An epic tale of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to hunt the white whale. The novel explores vengeance, fate, and humanity’s struggle against the unknown.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
annotation: A story of teenage alienation following Holden Caulfield as he searches for authenticity in a world he sees as fake. A timeless reflection on youth and rebellion.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
annotation: A monumental saga set during the Napoleonic Wars. The intertwined destinies of aristocratic families explore love, history, personal transformation, and national identity.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
annotation: A psychological drama about student Raskolnikov, who commits a crime believing he is above morality, only to face a moral and spiritual reckoning.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
annotation: A philosophical novel centered on the Karamazov family, dealing with themes of faith, free will, guilt, and the complexity of human nature.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
annotation: A charming adventure in which Bilbo Baggins embarks on a journey filled with danger, magic, and self-discovery, ultimately proving himself braver than he imagined.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
annotation: An epic fantasy saga about the struggle between light and darkness. The fate of Middle-earth depends on Frodo’s quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
annotation: A dystopian vision of a world engineered for stability, where individuality is replaced with manufactured happiness, prompting questions about freedom and humanity.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
annotation: A spiritual journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, filled with symbolism. Dante seeks meaning and salvation through poetic exploration of the human soul.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
annotation: A tragic love story about Anna, whose passionate affair leads to social ruin, contrasted with themes of morality, family, and inner harmony.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
annotation: A humorous yet profound tale of an idealistic knight and his loyal squire. The novel questions reality, dreams, and the nature of heroism.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
annotation: A dystopian story where books are banned and burned. Fireman Montag begins to question the oppressive system and seeks intellectual freedom.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
annotation: A modern reinterpretation of Homer’s Odyssey, set over the course of a single day. A bold literary experiment exploring human consciousness and city life.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
annotation: An ancient epic following Odysseus’s perilous journey home after the Trojan War, celebrating resilience, cleverness, loyalty, and fate.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
annotation: A monumental epic depicting the final events of the Trojan War. Heroism, wrath, and destiny intertwine against a backdrop of gods and warriors.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
annotation: A symbolic tale of a fisherman fighting a giant marlin. A story of dignity, perseverance, and inner strength in the face of defeat.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
annotation: A novel about the Lost Generation, exploring emotional emptiness, unfulfilled love, and the search for meaning in post-war Europe.

title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
author: Ernest Hemingway
annotation: A wartime drama about duty, sacrifice, and fleeting love, set during the Spanish Civil War. A reflection on idealism and mortality.

title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
annotation: A tragedy about Prince Hamlet, who seeks truth and justice for his father's death. The play explores doubt, revenge, and moral conflict.

title: Macbeth
author: William Shakespeare
annotation: A dark tragedy about ambition and power. Macbeth’s rise to the throne leads to guilt, madness, and destruction.

title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
annotation: A timeless tragedy of forbidden love between two young people from feuding families. Their fate exposes the costs of hatred and conflict.
